channel.title: New smart-phone theme
channel.description:
I installed a new theme for smart phones. I have personally tested it with Android 2.0 and it works great. A few others have tested with an iPhone and say it works as well.
I also wrote code to auto-detect and change your theme that currently works with Android and iPhones. If your mobile device supports the new theme, and you want me to auto-detect you, please visit http://www.moparisthebest.com/ip.php and paste me your user-agent.
You can force yourself to use that theme by going to: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?theme=5 And force yourself back by clicking classic, or visiting: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?theme=3
Give me feedback on this for things I should change, or how you like it. Test posts are acceptable in this thread: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,422850.msg3104026/boardseen.html#new
Thanks for Yz85Racer, pwnd_ and DansTheMan for helping me test it originally.

item.title: New smart-phone theme
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Elijah, post:20, topic:326444”]For some reason Firefox under linux keeps getting detected as the mobile browser. I’m guessing the script checks for Fx, Safari, IE6-8, Opera, and then everything else is mobile?

Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9.0.14) Gecko/2009090216 Ubuntu/9.04 (jaunty) Firefox/3.0.14[/quote]

No, that would be a pretty bad way to do it. Besides, my user-agent is almost identical to yours:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US; rv:1.9.1.7) Gecko/20100106 Ubuntu/9.10 (karmic) Firefox/3.5.7

Your problem is that you have your default theme for your account set to smart-phone. I’ve went ahead and changed it back to default for you.

edit:
If anyone is curious, this is how I detect whether to use the mobile theme or not:

[code]
// this came with SMF
‘is_iphone’ => strpos($_SERVER[‘HTTP_USER_AGENT’], ‘iPhone’) !== false || strpos($_SERVER[‘HTTP_USER_AGENT’], ‘iPod’) !== false,
// added android detection
‘is_android’ => strpos($_SERVER[‘HTTP_USER_AGENT’], ‘Android’) !== false,
);

//added mobile detection
$context[‘browser’][‘is_mobile’] = $context[‘browser’][‘is_iphone’] || $context[‘browser’][‘is_android’];[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: New smart-phone theme
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:15, topic:326444”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=422855.msg3105404#msg3105404 date=1264104877]

I like the iPhone one, it would be nice if the back button on the top toolbar took you up a level instead of returning to the classic theme.

That is how it originally was, with a back button. But I removed the back button and changed it to a classic button to switch back to the original theme.

I know that android phones have a hardware back button, and I was told iphones do too, so why is there a need for one?
[/quote]
The browser has a software back button, however, by “up a level” I didn’t mean “go back to the last history entry”. iPhone and iPod applications almost ubiquitously use that button as a back or up button, and honestly why would I want to go back to the classic theme? Surely you could put it in a less prominent place.[/quote]

Alright, I didn’t know that was the iphone’s ubiquitous back button, I’ll change it back I guess.

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:16, topic:326444”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=422855.msg3105577#msg3105577 date=1264111104]

pwnd_? wattttt
[/quote]I have an iPhone, therefore I am valuable to this project, LOL.

I could of sworn it was I who tested it with DanstheMan, but oh well.[/quote]

Yes, in the beginning, but pwnd_ is the first one who actually got it to work after fighting with dan’s obviously screwed up iphone for hours. Sorry about that, I’ll add you.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:326444”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=422855.msg3104902#msg3104902 date=1264047764]
I like the iPhone one, it would be nice if the back button on the top toolbar took you up a level instead of returning to the classic theme.
[/quote]

That is how it originally was, with a back button. But I removed the back button and changed it to a classic button to switch back to the original theme.

I know that android phones have a hardware back button, and I was told iphones do too, so why is there a need for one?[/quote]
The browser has a software back button, however, by “up a level” I didn’t mean “go back to the last history entry”. iPhone and iPod applications almost ubiquitously use that button as a back or up button, and honestly why would I want to go back to the classic theme? Surely you could put it in a less prominent place.
